page.title: 07FARMING
page.content: Within our unit there are 12 farms. The soil throughout the unit is rich and fertile, and most farms work a four year rotation of wheat or barley/grass/potatoes/turnips. The majority of the farms are some 400+ acres in extent, and have invested heavily in plant and machinery. With the emphasis on capital investment, little labour is needed, and most farms employ only 2/3 men. Some farms, however, have a few acres of strawberries or raspberries, in which the local schoolchildren find employment in the summer holidays. In addition, not all farms have completely mechanised their potato harvesting, and in the months of late Sep/Oct/early Nov, schoolchildren are employed to harvest the potato crop, earning up to Â£150 for their labours.
